metadata.synopsis: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -625.75, 14.74, 354.754. Talk with Elder Brithvar, convince him you are not a true soul (deception roll) and accept to help him.5. CTRL-Shift-K the Scrying eye.6. Destroy the rubbles holding Nere captive.7. Side with Nere in the mutiny (Thrinn must stay alive - you can achieve that by stopping Nere from killing the Gnomes) but resolve the combat by killing Nere and the rebels.8. Walk back to the main room, dialog should start afterward.

61.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
61.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

83.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
83.text: Listen, you pricks. Grab your gear and get ready to move.
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

0.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
0.text: Death-curse be damned, we're heading to Moonrise.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

64.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
64.text: It's time I met the General in the flesh.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: What about the slaves? What happens to them?

57.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
57.text: What else? They're coming with us. A gift to the General from his new faithful.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: Speak up, chief. You can't just let the clan keep them.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Symbol on NPC glowsInternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

3.speaker: Player
3.text: The gnomes won't survive the curse. What good is a gift of corpses?

45.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
45.text: Shit - you're on to something, hate to say.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Good idea. They will make a fine offering.

54.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
54.text: Yes. They will serve the Absolute's Chosen.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: Your heart made of stone? They deserved freedom - and you denied it.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: I'm... speechless. Wow. Just... just wow.
40.context: NodeContext: Appalled at what the player has just done.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Draw on the power within to enforce your will.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Call on the parasite, connect with Thrinn. 'The gnomes must go free.'

18.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
18.text: Fine. I'm in no mood to butt heads with another True Soul.

43.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
43.text: Get out of here, squat-pricks - before I toss you all in the fires.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the room in generalNodeContext: Addressed to the room in general

92.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
92.text: Then show me. And may the Absolute bless the victor!

87.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
87.text: Did She now? Well - not the time to go debatin' with a True Soul.

50.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
50.text: My arse, She did. If the Absolute wants 'em gone, the General himself will tell me.

5.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
5.text: Damn slaves better survive the journey before the death-curse chokes 'em.

63.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
63.text: I know what you're trying. And I won't stand for it, jargh!

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Call on the parasite, connect with Thrinn. 'The gnomes must go free.'

1.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
1.text: I... I was wrong. I must free them.

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: The gnomes should be able to go where they please. They are not the duergar's to keep.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: Hah. Bastard can dream on. Right?

25.speaker: Player
25.text: What can you tell me about the General?

86.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
86.text: Absolute's Chosen, Nere said. Building an army at Moonrise - nothing goes without his say-so.

35.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
35.text: I'll tell him how Nere failed, how the Absolute favoured me. He'll promote me to True Soul - I feel it in my bones.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The surface is dangerous. Are you sure it's safe to travel?

80.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
80.text: Don't you get it? Nere fell - and I'm the one standing.

38.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
38.text: The Absolute will clear my way. Not one shred of doubt.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You mentioned a death-curse. Is the journey so dangerous?

27.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
27.text: Nothing but cursed shadows from here to Moonrise.

23.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
23.text: But the Absolute's blessed me. She'll guide my steps.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

29.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
29.text: You got it, jargh. In the Absolute's name!

19.speaker: Player
19.text: You sicken me. It's time I cut you down once and for all.

85.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
85.text: Try it, jargh. Let's find out who the Absolute favours.

36.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
36.text: I'm going to Moonrise. And that death-curse won't be stopping me.
